revised_title: Spatial Structure and the Evolution of Honest Cost-Free Signaling
tldr: This article explores the impact of spatial structure on the evolution of honest cost-free signaling in animal populations. The authors demonstrate that spatial constraints can favor honest signaling even without costs, leading to the coexistence of "islands" of honesty in a sea of dishonesty. The extent to which honest or dishonest strategies are favored depends on the relative payoffs from signaling and receiving.
